ygData.subject: Re: Psalm of Warmth
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I tried this tonight in a party in lower guk. It worked nicely except it seems to have a nasty interaction bug with the Guise of the Deceiver Dark Elf
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, Jul 19/99, John Kim <kim@...> wrote:
>
> Psalm of Warmth is a very very very useful song if you're
> soloing. When soloing, nearly anything that gives you
> experience is going to hit you lots and lots of times. With
> the Psalm of Warmth's fire shield, your opponent takes damage
> every time he hits you. At L27 it was "only" 4 points per
> hit, but considering you're probably going to be hit 20-40
> times in a solo fight, that's 80-160 points of free damage.

I tried this tonight in a party in lower guk. It worked nicely except it
seems to have a nasty interaction bug with the Guise of the Deceiver
Dark Elf illusion. One of the people I party with is a Troll and the
Dark Elf illusion has been a godsend for dungeon crawling, as it's
fairly obvious that most dungeons weren't really designed to fit the
large races very well. However, when the Psalm ended, it also killed my
Troll friend's ultravision in Dark Elf mode. Weird bug. Psalm only does
7 dmg at L47 though, so it's not a huge loss, but as you point out,
those points add up in a long fight with a fast hitting mob.

--
